response.answer_text: I am a dentist and I know some other dentists that have done dentistry on themselves. On the whole their results were ordinary. Fillings looked worse and took longer than if another dentist had done them. I know one guy who tried to take out his own wisdom teeth - yeah that didn’t work and he had to get someone else to do it while everybody laughed at him. So depending on what you want to do it is possible. If you are a dentist and have a full working dental surgery at your disposal. If you are you are just some punter in your kitchen with a knife and some power tools you have no chance.

When will the litany of DIY medical/dental procedures ever end? Is DIY brain surgery possible? Are you isolated in the Antartic by chance? If so, your answer may be found by the one true exemplar, Dr. Rogozov, below. He would live another 39.5 years before passing away in St. Petersburg in 2000. Arden Kwong's answer to Can I use JB Weld to fill my teeth cavities?
